alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 4:42AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Arizona and southeast Arizona, including the following counties, in south central Arizona, Maricopa. In southeast Arizona, Pinal. * WHEN...Until 745 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 440 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated a line of showers producing heavy rain of up to one and one half inches per hour. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Phoenix, Glendale, Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, El Mirage, Tolleson, Youngtown, Laveen, Cashion, Sun City, Waddell, Sun City West, Maricopa, Litchfield Park, South Mountain Park, South Phoenix, Estrella Sailport, Phoenix International Raceway and Downtown Phoenix. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
